page.title: 05CHICHESTER_FIRE SERVICES.
page.content: { Chichester Fire Station}is located at {Northgate,}where it shares the site with the{West Sussex Brigade's HQ }and {Control Building.}The station provides fire_fighting and rescue services for Chichester and the surrounding area of about 906 sq.km. The firemen have to cope with everything from narrow and congested city streets to wooded areas and farms. Busy roads,railway lines,an airfield & a yacht marina add to their problems. The station is manned by 36 full time & 12 retained firemen, under the command of a Station Officer. The station is equipped with two pump appliances, rescue tender, breathing apparatus control vehicle & hydraulic platform.Chichester's biggest fire was in 1974 at Shirley's in North Street. The County HQ controls and monitors by computer all 999 fire calls in West Sussex for 20 stations in the area.
